{"step_by_step_thinking": "Type I collagen is the most abundant collagen of the human body. It is present in scar tissue, the end product when tissue heals by repair. It is also found in tendons, the endomysium of myofibrils, and the perimysium of muscles. Ligaments (A) also contain type I collagen, as do bones (C). Aponeurosis (B) is a type or a variant of the ligament and hence, it also contains type I collagen. However, cartilage (D) is primarily made up of type II collagen, not type I.", "answer_choice": "D"}
